expected_answer: Debt snowball pays off smallest debts first for motivation, while debt avalanche pays highest interest debts first to save money.
Debt avalanche saves more money over time by eliminating highest interest debt first.
Only paying minimums leads to accumulating interest, longer payoff time, and higher total cost.
Minimum payments are typically calculated as a percentage of balance plus interest, usually 2-3% of balance.
Debt snowball works better for psychological motivation and momentum when debts are similar in interest rates.
Revolving debt has flexible payments and no fixed term, installment debt has fixed payments and term.
High-interest debt costs more over time due to compound interest, so paying it first saves money.
Balance transfer moves debt to lower interest card, helping repay faster and save on interest.
Balance transfers risk higher fees, rate increases after promotional period, and credit score impact.
Debt consolidation combines multiple debts into single loan with potentially lower interest or payments.
Avoid consolidation if rates are higher, you have poor credit, or you continue spending habits.
Good credit utilization is below 30% of available credit limits.
Late payments lower credit score by 30-100 points and stay on report for 7 years.
Daily simple interest is calculated by multiplying balance by rate divided by 365.
Extra principal payments reduce balance faster, decreasing future interest calculations.
Amortization formula calculates equal payments covering principal and interest over loan term.
APR includes interest rate plus fees, giving true cost of borrowing.
PMI protects lender against default, required when down payment is less than 20%.
Early payments are mostly interest because principal balance is highest at loan start.
Fixed-rate mortgages have consistent payments, adjustable rates can change with market.
DTI is calculated by dividing total monthly debt payments by gross monthly income.
Good DTI ratio is below 36% for most lenders, lower is better.
Front-end DTI includes housing costs, back-end includes all debt payments.
High DTI reduces loan approval chances and may result in higher interest rates.
FICO scores range from 300 to 850, higher scores get better loan terms.
Payment history is 35% of credit score, most important factor.
Credit scores increase 1-3 points per month with consistent on-time payments.
Credit utilization over 30% hurts score, under 10% is ideal.
Hard inquiries lower score by few points, stay for 2 years on report.
401(k) contributions are pre-tax, reducing current taxable income.
Employer match is free money, maximize to get full employer contribution.
Roth IRA contributions are after-tax, withdrawals are tax-free in retirement.
Traditional IRA contributions may be tax-deductible, withdrawals taxed as income.
Emergency fund should cover 3-6 months of essential expenses.
High-yield savings earn 4-5% interest, much higher than traditional savings.
CDs offer higher interest than savings but require locking money for set period.
Index funds track market indices, providing diversification at low cost.
Dollar-cost averaging reduces market timing risk by investing fixed amounts regularly.
Asset allocation spreads investments across stocks, bonds, and cash.
Rebalancing restores target allocations, selling winners and buying losers.
529 plans offer tax-free growth for education expenses.
Coverdell ESA has lower contribution limits but similar tax benefits to 529.
Health Savings Accounts offer triple tax advantage: deductible, tax-free growth, tax-free withdrawals.
Life insurance provides financial protection for dependents after death.
Term life is cheaper pure protection, whole life builds cash value but costs more.
Disability insurance replaces income if unable to work due to illness or injury.
Umbrella policy provides additional liability coverage beyond auto/home policies.
Homeowners insurance covers dwelling, personal property, and liability.
Auto insurance covers bodily injury, property damage, and comprehensive/collision.
Dwelling coverage protects home structure, personal property covers contents.
Actual cash value minus depreciation, replacement cost covers rebuilding at current prices.
Deductible is amount you pay before insurance covers claim.
Bundling policies saves money through multi-policy discounts.
Annual review ensures coverage matches current needs and property values.
Student loans offer lower interest rates than private loans and flexible repayment.
Federal loans have fixed rates and benefits, private loans vary by lender.
Income-driven repayment caps payments at percentage of discretionary income.
Forbearance temporarily pauses payments, interest may still accrue.
Deferment pauses payments and interest accrual for certain situations.
Student loan forgiveness available for public service, teachers, nurses after 10 years.
401(k) loan allows borrowing up to 50% or $50,000 from retirement savings.
401(k) loans have 5-year repayment, interest paid back to your account.
401(k) hardship withdrawal incurs taxes and penalties, should be last resort.
Required Minimum Distribution starts at age 73, must withdraw annually.
Roth conversion moves money from traditional to Roth IRA, paying taxes now for tax-free withdrawals later.
Backdoor Roth IRA allows high earners to contribute through conversion.
SEP IRA for self-employed, higher contribution limits than traditional IRA.
SIMPLE IRA easier setup than 401(k), lower contribution limits.
529 plan contributions grow tax-free, withdrawals tax-free for qualified education.
Coverdell ESA $2,000 annual limit, can be used for K-12 education expenses.
ABLE account for disabled individuals, similar to 529 but for disability expenses.
Estate planning protects assets and ensures wishes are followed after death.
Will directs asset distribution, trust avoids probate and provides control.
Power of attorney grants someone authority to make financial or medical decisions.
Healthcare directive specifies medical treatment preferences if incapacitated.
Estate tax applies to estates over exemption amount, currently $13.61 million.
Probate is court process validating will and distributing assets.
Living trust avoids probate, provides privacy and faster asset transfer.
Guardian appointed by court to manage affairs of incapacitated person.
Tax basis determines capital gains tax when assets are sold.
Step-up in basis resets asset value to fair market value at death.
Annual gift tax exclusion allows $18,000 gifts per person tax-free.
Lifetime exemption protects large gifts from estate tax.
Charitable remainder trust provides income then donates remainder.
Generation-skipping trust transfers wealth multiple generations tax-free.
Medicaid look-back period is 5 years for asset transfers.
Long-term care insurance covers nursing home and home care costs.
Hybrid LTC policies combine life insurance with long-term care benefits.
Reverse mortgage allows borrowing against home equity without monthly payments.
Reverse mortgage reduces home equity, borrower must maintain home and pay taxes.
Annuities provide guaranteed income stream in retirement.
Fixed annuities guarantee payment amount, variable annuities fluctuate with investments.
Immediate annuities start payments immediately, deferred annuities grow then pay.
Qualified longevity annuity contract defers payments to later age for higher amounts.
Social Security benefits based on lifetime earnings, higher earnings mean higher benefits.
Full retirement age is between 66-67 depending on birth year.
Early retirement reduces benefits 5-6% per month before full retirement age.
Delayed retirement increases benefits 8% per year after full retirement age.
Social Security tax rate is 6.2% each for employee and employer, total 12.4%.
Social Security wage base limit is $168,600 in 2024, no tax on earnings above this.
